meanings.definition: To take the place of something or someone
meanings.sent1: The new book will displace the old one on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The young actor hoped to displace the famous star in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to displace the dog from its cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter seemed to displace all sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun rays seemed to displace the dark clouds, bringing warmth and light.

meanings.definition: To force something or someone out of its usual or original position
meanings.sent1: The strong wind can displace the sand on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake could displace many families from their homes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to displace the bird from its nest.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice seemed to displace all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The heavy traffic can displace the calm atmosphere of the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To cause something to move from its usual place
meanings.sent1: The flood can displace objects in the house.
meanings.sent2: The construction work might displace the rocks in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The playful child tried to displace the toys from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden sneeze seemed to displace the papers on the desk.
meanings.sent5: The strong current can displace the fish from their hiding spots.
